message.raw:
Pleiades now working.  Serious hack to distutils to get h5py working (edit to unixccompiler).  But we run!

Dedalus now working on Pleiades.  First tests occuring now, but we've successfully started up on anelastic convection and built pencils, done first timesteps, etc.  Still need to check that h5py outputs are actually working, etc.

Pleiades now working. Serious hack to distutils to get h5py working (edit to unixccompiler). But we run!

Dedalus now working on Pleiades. First tests occuring now, but we've successfully started up on anelastic convection and built pencils, done first timesteps, etc. Still need to check that h5py outputs are actually working, etc.

message.raw:
Update to stampede docs for compilation of numpy under MKL.

We now appear to be working with MKL as well as OpenBLAS
on Stampede.  Numpy passes np.test(); legendre_transforms
pass test_legendre_transform.py accuracy test.  Timing
indicates that the MKL transforms are slow, but we may
be seeing a threading discrepency between MKL and openblas
(unclear whether the chosen MKL library handles threads).
message.html:
Update to stampede docs for compilation of numpy under MKL.

We now appear to be working with MKL as well as OpenBLAS
on Stampede. Numpy passes np.test(); legendre_transforms
pass test_legendre_transform.py accuracy test. Timing
indicates that the MKL transforms are slow, but we may
be seeing a threading discrepency between MKL and openblas
(unclear whether the chosen MKL library handles threads).

on Stampede.  Numpy passes np.test(); legendre_transforms
pass test_legendre_transform.py accuracy test.  Timing
indicates that the MKL transforms are slow, but we may
be seeing a threading discrepency between MKL and openblas
(unclear whether the chosen MKL library handles threads).

message.raw:
Adding initial sphinx auto-doc pages.

This is an experiment with Sphinx.  Right now it does auto-documentation of the legendre transform routines in Ben's fork, and also includes some notes on using restructured text, sphinx, and our Trestle and Mac install notes.  This is a first rough cut, but it looks very promising.

--Ben Brown, 1/7/14

message.raw:
Initial build script for RHEL 6.

We're addressing one last stumbling block: RHEL stores its include and lib files in an unusual directory naming scheme, and we need to parse around this.  Owing to this, the cythonizing stage of dedalus2 itself currently fails.  Should be fixed shortly.

Thanks to Jeff Oishi for a lot of debugging on getting RHEL up and running.  Thanks also to Jim Mckown at JILA for his help.
message.html:

Thanks to Jeff Oishi for a lot of debugging on getting RHEL up and running. Thanks also to Jim Mckown at JILA for his help.
